paragraphs.content: Long before our ancestors had any trappings of civilisation, they had a taste for material goods. Kate Douglas discovers where this ancient obsession has led us.

questions.instruction:

Write the correct letter in boxes 19–21 on your answer sheet.

content.questionText: In section A, ‘reciprocity' refers to our ancestors' ability to

options.label: A
options.text: Akeep written records of different goods traded

options.label: B
options.text: Bmonitor the balance between goods given and received

options.label: C
options.text: Cproduce more materials for trading purposes

options.label: D
options.text: Dmake money from trading goods and services

content.questionText: What is said about the ochre found at Blombos Cave?

options.label: A
options.text: AIt is of a type only found in this particular area.

options.label: B
options.text: BIt has all been dyed to give the same shade of red.

options.label: C
options.text: CIt has been perfectly preserved despite its age.

options.label: D
options.text: DIt appears it was selected for its colour.

content.questionText: What made the researchers realise the purpose of the beads found at Blombos Cave?

options.label: A
options.text: AThey are of many different shapes and sizes.

options.label: B
options.text: BThey were found in large numbers, clustered together.

options.label: C
options.text: CThey have patterns in many different colours.

options.label: D
options.text: DThey have holes and markings suggesting they were joined together.
